question: Valid Palindrome
intuition: Socho aise - string ke start aur end se ek ek pointer lo. Dono ko middle ki taraf move karo. Har step pe check karo ki dono characters same hain ya nahi (spaces aur special chars ko skip karo). Agar kabhi bhi mismatch mile, return false. Agar dono pointers cross kar jaayein bina kisi mismatch ke, matlab palindrome hai!

question: Reverse String
intuition: Simple hai bhai! Ek pointer start pe rakho (i=0), doosra end pe (j=n-1). Dono ke characters swap karo, phir i ko aage badhaao, j ko peeche. Jab tak i < j, swap karte raho. In-place ho jaayega reverse!

question: Squares of a Sorted Array
intuition:
Dekho, array sorted hai but negative numbers bhi hain. Negative ka square positive ho jaata hai, toh directly sort nahi kar sakte.

Trick: Do pointers lo - ek start pe, ek end pe. Compare karo absolute values. Jo bada hai uska square result array ke END mein daalo (kyunki sorted order chahiye). Pointer move karo accordingly.

Kyun kaam karta hai? Kyunki sorted array mein sabse bade squares ya toh start pe honge (negative numbers) ya end pe (positive numbers).

question: Valid Palindrome II
intuition:
Normal palindrome check ki tarah do pointers se shuru karo. Jab mismatch mile, tab 2 options hain - ya toh left character hataao, ya right.

Dono cases check karo (recursively ya helper function se). Agar kisi bhi case mein remaining substring palindrome hai, return true.

Ek hi deletion ki permission hai, toh zyada complicated nahi hai!

question: Valid Word Abbreviation
intuition: Word aur abbreviation ke liye do pointers chalao. Abbreviation me digits aayengi to unhe ek number banao jo batata hai ki original word me kitne characters skip karne hain. Leading zero allow nahi hai. Har letter match karo; mismatch ya boundary cross hui to false. Dono pointers end tak safely pahunch gaye to true.

question: Merge Sorted Array
intuition: Dono arrays ke end se merge karo. Kyun? Kyunki nums1 me extra space last me hai; peeche se fill karoge to overwrite issue nahi hoga. i = m-1, j = n-1, k = m+n-1. Jo bada element hai usse nums1[k] me daalte jao, pointers move karo.

question: Count Pairs Whose Sum is Less than Target
intuition: Array sort karo. Do pointers lo: left start pe, right end pe. Agar nums[left] + nums[right] < target hai, to left ke saath jitne elements left+1..right tak hain sab valid pairs hain (count += right-left), phir left++. Agar sum bada ya equal ho to right--. O(n log n) sort + O(n) scan.

question: Two Sum
intuition: Unsorted array hai, isliye hashmap best hai. Ek pass me chalo: current number ke liye complement = target - num. Agar map me complement mila to answer mil gaya. Nahi to current index store karo. O(n) time, O(n) space.

question: Two Sum II - Input Array Is Sorted
intuition: Array sorted hai, to do pointers simple solution hai. Start left=0, right=n-1. Sum compare karo target se. Sum chhota hai to left++, sum bada hai to right--, match mila to indices (1-based) return karo.

question: 3Sum
intuition: Sort karo, fir har index ko fix karke baaki do numbers two-pointer se dhundo. Duplicates skip karo (fixed index aur left/right move dono par). Target 0 hai to sum = nums[i] + nums[l] + nums[r]. Sum chhota to l++, sum bada to r--, match mila to add list aur duplicates skip karo.
